articles.title: ApexCharts: Interactive Charting and Dataviz Library
articles.description: A mature and frequently updated charting library for building interactive data visualizations, whether with sparklines, heatmaps, line charts, funnel charts, pies, and others. There are many visual demos and code samples ‚Äì or check out their homepage.
articles.author: Juned Chhipa

articles.title: Node.js 21 Released
articles.description: In the next week or so, Node v21 replaces v20 as the ‚Äòcurrent‚Äô release that gets the new features first, with Node v20 becoming the 'active' LTS version. v21 introduces V8 11.8, npm 10.2, stable Web Streams support, and an experimental browser-compatible WebSocket implementation.
articles.author: The Node.js Project

articles.title: Eight Options to Reduce JavaScript Code
articles.description: Solid.js creator Ryan Carniato thinks it‚Äôs time to reduce the footprint of JavaScript code. Here‚Äôs a two part series covering several approaches, covering areas from code splitting to progressive hydration and hybrid routing.
articles.author: Loraine Lawson (The New Stack)

articles.title: The Nuances of Base64 Encoding Strings in JavaScript
articles.description: Base64 provides a way to represent binary data in ASCII strings which may be safer to share and store in certain situations. Matt looks at how to do Base64 encoding and decoding in JavaScript and some areas where you need to take special care.
articles.author: Matt Joseph

articles.title: event.target.closest
articles.description: If you‚Äôve not used closest, it‚Äôs worth being aware of this way to return the closest DOM node that matches a specified CSS selector (based upon traversal of the DOM tree up towards the root).
articles.author: Jeremy Keith

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Prototyping a JavaScript JIT Compiler
articles.description: It almost feels like building a JIT compiler has become the new ‚Äúhello world‚Äù (ok, slight exaggeration) but this 80 minute screencast is fascinating (and, amazingly, demystifies some of the magic) if you have the time and inclination.
articles.author: Andreas Kling

articles.title: New Angular 17 Feature: Deferred Loading
articles.description: Next level lazy-loading demonstrated by using a Signal-based and other examples.
articles.author: Gergely Szerovay

articles.title: Postgres.js 3.4: A Full-Featured Postgres Client for All
articles.description: Now working with several JavaScript platforms (Node, Deno, Bun, and, as of this release, Cloudflare), this high performance Postgres library offers realtime change subscription, dynamic query building via special template literals, high availability support via multi-host connection URLs, async cursors, and more.
articles.author: Rasmus Porsager

articles.title: PureImage: A Pure JS HTML Canvas 2D for Node.js
articles.description: If you want a browser-like 2D canvas experience in Node but without any native dependencies, this is for you. You can then save the output to PNG or JPEG. (node-canvas is the long-standing popular choice in this same area but relies upon Cairo as a dependency.)
articles.author: Josh Marinacci

articles.title: Cronicle: A Cron System with a Web Front End
articles.description: Describing itself as ‚Äòa fancy cron replacement‚Äô, Cronicle is a task scheduler and runner built in Node.js with a web-based UI.
articles.author: Joseph Huckaby

articles.title: Timeline JS: Create Useful Timelines for the Web
articles.description: Built by a journalism lab at a university, this is not aimed at expert developers but folks focused on telling a story or presenting some data online. Here‚Äôs an example showing a timeline of ‚Äòrevolutionary user interfaces.‚Äô
articles.author: Northwestern University Knight Lab

articles.title: table-saw: A Small Web Component for Responsive HTML¬†Tables
articles.description: Inspired by a jQuery plugin with a similar name. Check out some some demos.
articles.author: Zach Leatherman

articles.title: QX82: Retro-Inspired Computing in a JavaScript Library
articles.description: With a name riffing on the ZX81 computer, QX82‚Äôs goal is to let you create retro-feeling (mid 80s, to be precise) games and experiences with JavaScript. It‚Äôs not a runtime or emulator - you could bake this into your own web site, if you wanted.
articles.author: Bruno Oliveira

articles.description: TanStack Query v5 ‚Äì Query-led declarative state management and data fetching.
Storybook 7.5 ‚Äì Frontend component dev tool. Now with Vite 5 and Lit 3 support, faster starts, and Angular-focused improvements.
Lit 3.0 ‚Äì Build agnostic components on top of modern Web standards.
Rockpack 4.0 ‚Äì React app starter/generator.
Astro 3.3, Biome 1.3, and Bun 1.0.6.

articles.title: How Custom Property Values are Computed
articles.description: Stephanie brings us up to speed on how browsers compute CSS custom property values, noting that a misunderstanding of this process may lead to unexpected or missing values. She shares some simple strategies we can use to avoid custom property failure.
articles.author: Stephanie Eckles

articles.title: CSS Findings from Photoshop's Web Version
articles.description: A few weeks ago we shared an update about how Adobe took Photoshop to the web. Now Ahmad has taken a look over the impressive effort, digging into the CSS of the web version of this mammoth app.
articles.author: Ahmad Shadeed

articles.title: HTML Tags Memory Test: Test How Well You Remember 100+ HTML¬†Tags
articles.description: Just start typing HTML tag names to see how many you can remember. Guaranteed to drive you to despair when you give up and find out you missed some easy ones you use all the time! ü§£
articles.author: Paul Foster

articles.title: CSS Relative Color Syntax
articles.description: This post runs through how to use new, powerful color syntax features (in Chrome as of version 119) that allow you to make dynamic color adjustments (such as lighten, darken, invert, saturate, etc) along with demonstrating some common color manipulation use cases.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: The Negative Impact of Mobile-First Web Design on Desktop
articles.description: Some considered criticism about mobile-first design highlighting a handful of usability issues dubbed here as ‚Äòcontent dispersion‚Äô. Whether you agree with it though‚Ä¶
articles.author: Salazar, Neusesser, Chitale

articles.title: Scroll-Driven State Transfer
articles.description: Roman continues his spelunking into all things relating to scroll-driven animations, this time looking at how to transfer the state of one element to another placed at a different point on the page. This is done by using a unique identifier in CSS via timeline-scope.
articles.author: Roman Komarov

articles.title: The Ultimate Design Guide for 'Table of Contents' Features
articles.description: ‚ÄúWhen designing a table of contents, carefully compare different placement and styling options to maximize usability‚Äù.
articles.author: Huei-Hsin Wang and Matt Brown

articles.title: table-saw: A Small Web Component for Responsive HTML¬†Tables
articles.description: Inspired by an older jQuery plugin with a similar name. You can try out some demos here, one of which uses container queries.
articles.author: Zach Leatherman

articles.title: Build a Better Mobile Input: Generate HTML Inputs Optimized for¬†Mobile
articles.description: This little interactive page lets you experiment with different form field attributes like type, inputmode, and autocomplete, with the result displaying on a mock device as either iOS or Android.
articles.author: Alex Holachek

articles.title: audioMotion-analyzer: A Real-Time Audio Spectrum Analyzer
articles.description: A high-resolution real-time audio spectrum analyzer JavaScript module with no dependencies. Gives a single or dual channel view. (Note the AGPL license.) GitHub repo.
articles.author: Henrique Avila Vianna

articles.title: CSS Size Analyzer
articles.description: This tool analyzes CSS code to identify large rules and selectors. You might find that there are large CSS selectors generated by Sass or assets like images or fonts embedded in the file.
articles.author: DebugBear

articles.title: VOV.CSS: A Utility Library of Useful CSS Animations
articles.description: We shared a similar older project a few issues ago called Mimic.css. This one includes animations that are a little more run-of-the-mill, and of course you can try out each one directly on the page.
articles.author: Vaibhav Tandon

articles.title: tailwindcss-3d: Add 3D Transforms to Tailwind
articles.description: Tailwind‚Äôs core utility classes support 2D transforms (i.e. x and y axes only). This plugin will add support for 3D transforms (z axis) and includes a legacy mode for older browser support.
articles.author: Sam Bauers

articles.title: selectors.info: A Simple Interactive Tool to Learn CSS Selectors
articles.author: selectors‚Ä§info

articles.description: Astro 3.3 is out now with a new, experimental <Picture/> component.
The latest list of emoji recommendations drafted by the Unicode Consortium, Emoji 15.1, has been formally approved with 118 new emoji.
The 'State of the Word' WordPress survey is open & seeking responses.
ActivityPub is now available across all WordPress.com sites.
